channel.title: Willow Glen 5K Run/Walk
channel.description: Recent content on Willow Glen 5K Run/Walk

item.title: Official Willow Glen 5K Course
item.description: If you want to stick to the official Willow Glen 5K course. Here it is. When in doubt, opt for the real deal! Route map for Official WG5K course

item.title: San Jose Swim and Racquet Club
Naval Base in Alameda
item.description: You don’t need to be in Willow Glen to run. If you live in Oakland, try the Naval Base loop in Alameda. Route map for Naval Base Alameda 5K

item.title: 3 Creeks Trail
item.description: If you live around the 3 Creeks trail, try out this course that winds through the neighborhoods east of downtown and has a quiet jaunt on the 3 Creeks trail. Route map for WG5K 3 Creeks Trail And Neighborhoods

item.title: Dev Davis City Councilmember
item.description: My goal is to actively engage and communicate with all residents in our community. District 6 staff members and I welcome your questions, comments or concerns anytime.

item.title: SDS NexGen & Mulcahy Family
item.description: SDS NexGen Partners is a privately held real estate and investment firm based in San Jose, California.

item.title: WGE Newport 5K
item.description: Do you live between Lincoln and Meridian. Try out the Newport to Curtner loop and run past the Willow Glen high school fields. Route map for WGE Newport 5K

item.title: Athletic Treads
item.description: Our store is closed for in-store shopping (during the shelter in place), but we have launched a contactless, free home delivery or curbside pickup option. Please give us a call at the phone number listed below and let us know what shoe model / size you are looking for. If you are not sure what shoe is best for your foot type, please ask us for a Virtual Fitting or Social Distancing House Call.

item.title: Berliner Cohen LLP
item.description: We know that these are strange times for everyone. We are sorry we can’t enjoy our great California weather with everyone at the Willow Glen 5K. While you are sheltering in place, Berliner Cohen, LLP thought you would enjoy learning some strange laws that have existed in California.

item.title: Bobby Blue
item.description: bobbyblue is a consulting business for web development and visual design services. Founded in 1998, bobbyblue provides for the needs of communications and interaction within digital and print media. bobbyblue helps customers realize their ideas through a detail-oriented service, is focused on meeting clients goals, and maintains scalablity to adjust for large and small projects. Client types have included: silicon valley corporations, life sciences, restaurants, real estate, politics, phone companies, schools, theatres, artists, other design firms and individuals.

item.title: California Sports Center
item.description: California Sports Center provides the opportunity to become the best you can be! CSC believes teaching gymnastics, swimming, and dance in fun, progressive, and safe learning environments will result in happier and healthier people. Check out our full online schedule Catch up with us on Facebook Take in some free videos from our gym

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: For race information info@willowglen5k.org Social Media Follow us on Facebook Twitter

item.title: Kristen Brown for Trustee Area 3
item.description: My name is Kristen Brown, and I want to represent our Willow Glen Community on the San Jose Unified School Board. The position I am running for is Trustee Area Three which includes the district schools of Booksin, Ernesto Galarza, Gardner, Hammer Montessori, River Glen, Schallenberger, as well as Willow Glen Elementary, Middle and High Schools.

item.title: Lynsie Gridley
item.description: Lynsie is a seasoned, future forward, professional realtor. She specializes in the sales and marketing of homes and residential lots.

item.title: Mashouf Orthodontics
item.description: Mashouf Orthodontics is a leading South Bay area orthodontic practice that is located in the heart of San Jose. Our orthodontists, Drs. Kayhan Mashouf, Shannon Hayashibara, and Cameron Mashouf, along with their team of professionals are committed to excellence in patient treatment and service. Whether you’re looking for an orthodontist to provide your child with early or adolescent treatment or are interested in adult treatment for yourself, we can meet all your family’s orthodontic needs in one convenient location.

item.title: Race
item.description: Course Description The Willow Glen 5K course is fast and flat. The 5K starts in downtown Willow Glen at the corner of Lincoln Ave. at Minnesota and finishes 200 yards from the starting line in the Willow Glen Elementary School courtyard. The course is marked, well-labeled and measured to an accurate distance. Volunteers and police will monitor the cross-traffic at most intersections. Volunteers and community groups will line the race course to cheer you on and provide entertainment.

item.title: Registration
item.description: Sign up at the Willow Glen 5K registration site Packet Pickup Times TBD! Locations SJSRC : 1170 Pedro Street San Jose, CA 95126 Willow Glen Elementary: 1425 Lincoln Ave, San Jose, CA 95125 Fees Adult (20+): $30 (includes t-shirt, race number and race bag with sponsor offers) Teen (5-19): $20 (includes t-shirt, race number and race bag with sponsor offers) Child (4 and under): Free ($10 for t-shirt) You must register (and obtain a race number) in order to cross the finish line.

item.title: Sponsorships
item.description: Reach highly-targeted customers and give back to local schools! The Willow Glen 5K RUN/WALK for Education is a successful volunteer-coordinated community race through the Willow Glen neighborhood of San Jose. This event includes an average of 2,000 participants each year, ranging from recognized local runners to parents pushing strollers. Racers, families and neighbors then join together at the finish line for a post-race festival featuring sponsor signage, booths, pancake breakfast, kid zone, and promotional swag.

item.title: Volunteers
item.description: Our annual event can only happen because of people like you willing to give their time and energy to benefit local schools. Volunteers are needed in varying shifts from 6am – 2pm on race day, Saturday, May 13, 2023. Volunteer needs include: festival setup, registration, kids’ zone helpers, water stations, race course control, medical support, finish line and post-race Festival. We welcome adults and students, individually or with schools, civic clubs and community organizations to help.
